channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Shopping Trolley, 18th August
item.description:
1 shopping trolley on pavement here, I think it was Sainsbury's.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Mews, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Filthy litter bin right by the bus stop, 18th August
item.description:
This bin is used for doggy bags and rubbish, witnessed someone putting a doggy bag into the bin, (we were waiting for a bus), and swarms of small flies flew out of the bin and surrounded us, it was disgusting, please can this bin be moved away from the bus stop and put just up the road by the path to the park (opposite Sidewood Rd) it would be less hazardous there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 154, Avery Hill Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cyclist on Pavement, 18th August
item.description:
While the signs are out stating road closed, cyclists are mounting the pavement, some at speed to get past the roadworks. As old people and children you this road to get to Hoxton. It is only a matter of time before someone is injured.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pitfield Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Continuing Litter Issue, 18th August
item.description:
Once again, as you can see from the attached picture, the bin bags are not getting cleared outside Sainsbury's and the surrounding bushes are full of these things and litter attracting much wildlife. I KNOW THIS IS SAINSBURY'S RESPONSIBILITY, but as reported many times before, Sainsbury's is not doing what they are supposed to be doing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food waste constant spillages on public footpath, 18th August
item.description:
Viola instruct the local road sweeper to leave the garbage including food stuffs on the pavement for collection. Liquid and food stuffs regularly leak onto the pavement causing slip hazards, encouraging vermin and leaving unsightly food spillages that turn black on the walk way. Location is just beyond the corner of Beckenham High Street and The Drive BR3 1EN just beyond the shop Creases and adjacent to the telecoms cupboard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 194 - 200, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
